semantic_title: Sequelae (Late Effects) of External Cause Guidelines
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 20. Chapter 20: External Causes of Morbidity > i. Sequelae (Late Effects) of External Cause Guidelines

content.full_text: Sequelae (Late Effects) of External Cause Guidelines cover the use of external cause codes with 7th character 'S' for sequela, their relationship with current injuries, and appropriate use for subsequent visits. (Evidence: pg no: 91, L28-L36)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding sequelae of external causes using 7th character 'S' and proper sequencing rules (Evidence: pg no: 91, L28-L36)
key_concepts: Sequelae use 7th character 'S' (Evidence: pg no: 91, L30)
Used for late effects of previous injuries (Evidence: pg no: 91, L31)
Never used with related current injury codes (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)
Specific rules for subsequent visits (Evidence: pg no: 91, L34-L36)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Sequela are reported using external cause code with 7th character 'S' (Evidence: pg no: 91, L30)
detailed_rules.explanation: When coding late effects or sequelae of previous injuries, use the appropriate external cause code with the 7th character 'S' to indicate sequela (Evidence: pg no: 91, L30-L31)
common_applications: Chronic conditions resulting from past trauma

detailed_rules.rule_text: Never use sequela external cause code with related current nature of injury code (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)
detailed_rules.explanation: A sequela external cause code should not be used simultaneously with a current injury code for the same condition (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify if condition is a late effect of previous injury
Step 2: Use external cause code with 7th character 'S'
Step 3: Ensure no current injury code for same condition is used
Step 4: Apply appropriate subsequent visit rules

code_patterns.description: Pattern for sequela external cause codes (Evidence: pg no: 91, L30)
code_patterns.explanation: The 'S' indicates this is a sequela or late effect code

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient being treated for chronic pain resulting from previous motor vehicle accident
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Chronic back pain, sequela of motor vehicle accident 2 years ago
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify this as a late effect of previous injury
Step 2: Use appropriate external cause code with 7th character 'S'
Step 3: Do not use current injury codes
Step 4: Code the current condition being treated

correct_coding.sequencing: Current condition first, then sequela external cause
correct_coding.rationale: Treating late effect of previous injury (Evidence: pg no: 91, L30-L31)

incorrect_coding.code: Current injury code with sequela external cause
incorrect_coding.rationale: Cannot use sequela external cause with current injury code for same condition
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using both current and sequela codes for same condition

warnings: Never use sequela external cause code with related current injury code (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)
best_practices: Use 7th character 'S' for all sequela external cause codes (Evidence: pg no: 91, L30)
Apply to any late effect or sequela of previous injury (Evidence: pg no: 91, L31)
common_mistakes: Using sequela codes with current injury codes for same condition (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)
tips: Reference Section I.B.10 for general sequela guidelines (Evidence: pg no: 91, L31)
